properties.brief_desc: Rock cairn and plaques on Ongul Island, Prins Harald Kyst
properties.full_descr: Rock cairn and plaques at Syowa Station in memory of Shin Fukushima, a member of the 4th Japanese Antarctic Research Expedition, who died in October 1960 while performing official duties. The cairn was erected on 11 January 1961, by his colleagues. Some

properties.brief_desc: Observatory at Bunger Hills, Queen Mary Land
properties.full_descr: Building (magnetic observatory) at Dobrowolsky Station, Bunger Hills, with plaque in memory of the opening of Oasis Station in 1956.

properties.brief_desc: Cemetery on Buromskiy Island, Queen Mary Land
properties.full_descr: Cemetery on Buromskiy Island, near Mirny Observatory, in which are buried Soviet, Czechoslovakian and GDR citizens, members of Soviet Antarctic Expeditions, who perished in the performance of official duties on 3 August1960.

properties.brief_desc: Ice cave at Inexpressible Island, Terra Nova Bay, Scott Coast
properties.full_descr: Site of ice cave at Inexpressible Island, Terra Nova Bay, constructed in March 1912 by Victor Campbell?s Northern Party, British Antarctic Expedition, 1910?13. The party spent the winter of 1912 in this ice cave. A wooden sign, plaque and seal bones rema

properties.brief_desc: Hut at Cape Royds, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Hut built in February 1908 by the British Antarctic Expedition of 1907?09, led by Sir Ernest Shackleton. Restored in January 1961 by the Antarctic Division of New Zealand Department of Scientific and Industrial Research.

properties.brief_desc: Hut at Cape Evans, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Hut built in January 1911 by the British Antarctic Expedition of 1910?13, led by Captain Robert F. Scott. Restored in January 1961 by the Antarctic Division of New Zealand Department of Scientific and Industrial Research.

properties.brief_desc: Cross at Cape Evans, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Cross on Wind Vane Hill, Cape Evans, Ross Island, erected by the Ross Sea Party, led by Captain Aeneas Mackintosh, of Sir Ernest Shackleton?s Imperial Trans?Antarctic Expedition of 1914?16, in memory of three members of the party who died in the vicinity

properties.brief_desc: Hut at Hut Point, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Hut built in February 1902 by the British Antarctic Expedition of 1901?04, led by Captain Robert F. Scott. Partially restored in January 1964 by the New Zealand Antarctic Society, with assistance from the United States Government.

properties.brief_desc: Cross at Hut Point, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Cross erected in February 1904 by the British Antarctic Expedition of 1901?04, in memory of George Vince, a member of the expedition, who died in the vicinity.

properties.brief_desc: Cross on Observation Hill, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Cross erected in January 1913 by the British Antarctic Expedition of 1910?13, in memory of Captain Robert F. Scott?s party which perished on the return journey from the South Pole in March 1912.

properties.brief_desc: Hut at Cape Crozier, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Remains of stone hut constructed in July 1911 by Edward Wilson?s party of the British Antarctic Expedition (1910?13) during the winter journey to collect Emperor penguin eggs.

properties.brief_desc: Hut at Cape Adare, Borchgrevink Coast
properties.full_descr: Three huts and associated historic relics at Cape Adare. Two were built in February 1899 during the British Antarctic (Southern Cross) Expedition, 1898?1900, led by Carsten E. Borchgrevink. The third was built in February 1911 by Robert F. Scott?s Northe

properties.brief_desc: Flag mast at South Pole
properties.full_descr: Flag mast erected in December 1965 at the South Geographical Pole by the First Argentine Overland Polar Expedition.

properties.brief_desc: Installations at Barry Island, Debenham Islands, Marguerite Bay, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Abandoned installations of Argentine Station ?General San Martin? on Barry Island, Debenham Islands, Marguerite Bay, with cross, flag mast, and monolith built in 1951.

properties.brief_desc: Cairn with plaque at Megalestris Hill, Petermann Island, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Cairn with a replica of a lead plaque erected on Megalestris Hill, Petermann Island, in 1909 by the second French expedition led by Jean?Baptiste E. A. Charcot. The original plaque is in the reserves of the Museum National d?Histoire Naturelle (Paris).

properties.brief_desc: Cairn, pillar and plaque at Port Charcot, Booth Island, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Rock cairn with wooden pillar and plaque inscribed with the names of the first French expedition led by Jean?Baptiste E. A. Charcot which wintered here in 1904 aboard Le Franais.

properties.brief_desc: Lighthouse on Lambda Island, Melchior Islands, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Lighthouse named ?Primero de Mayo? erected by Argentina in 1942. This was the first Argentine lighthouse in the Antarctic.

properties.brief_desc: Monolith on Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: Concrete monolith erected in 1947, near Capitn Arturo Prat Base on Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands. Point of reference for Chilean Antarctic hydrographic surveys. The monolith is representative of an important pre?IGY activity and is currently

properties.brief_desc: Grave at Cape Adare, Borchgrevink Coast
properties.full_descr: Grave at Cape Adare of Norwegian biologist Nicolai Hanson, a member of the British Antarctic (Southern Cross) Expedition, 1898?1900, led by Carsten E. Borchgrevink. A large boulder marks the head of the grave with the grave itself outlined in white quar

properties.brief_desc: Rock cairn at Mount Betty, Queen Maud Range
properties.full_descr: Rock cairn, known as ?Amundsen?s cairn?, on Mount Betty, Queen Maud Range erected by Roald Amundsen on 6 January 1912, on his way back to Framheim from the South Pole.

properties.brief_desc: Monument sledge and plaque at Mabus Point, Queen Mary Land
properties.full_descr: Metal monument?sledge at Mirny Observatory, Mabus Point, with plaque in memory of driver?mechanic Anatoly Shcheglov who perished in the performance of official duties.

properties.brief_desc: Shelter, cross and plaque on Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: Shelter and cross with plaque near Capitn Arturo Prat Base (Chile), Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands. Named in memory of Lieutenant?Commander Gonzlez Pacheco, who died in 1960 while in charge of the station. The monument commemorates events rel

properties.brief_desc: Bust on Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: Bust at Capitn Arturo Prat Base (Chile), Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands, of the Chilean naval hero Arturo Prat, erected in 1947. The monument is representative of pre?IGY activities and has symbolic value in the context of Chilean presence in

properties.brief_desc: Cross and statue on Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: Wooden cross and statue of the Virgin of Carmen erected in 1947 near Capitn Arturo Prat Base (Chile), Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands. The monument is representative of pre?IGY activities and has a particularly symbolic and architectural value.

properties.brief_desc: Statue at Trinity Peninsula, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Statue erected in 1948 at General Bernardo O?Higgins Base (Chile), Trinity Peninsula, of Bernardo O?Higgins, the first ruler of Chile to envisage the importance of Antarctica. This monument is representative of pre?IGY activities in Antarctica and has a

properties.brief_desc: Hut on Snow Hill Island, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Wooden hut built in February 1902 by the main party of the Swedish South Polar Expedition led by Otto Nordenskjld.

properties.brief_desc: Hut at Hope Bay, Trinity Peninsula, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Stone hut built in January 1903 by a party of the Swedish South Polar Expedition.

properties.brief_desc: Bust, grotto, statue, flag mast, graveyard and stele at Hope Bay, Trinity Peninsula, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Bust of General San Martin, grotto with a statue of the Virgin of Lujan, and a flag mast at Base ?Esperanza?, Hope Bay, erected by Argentina in 1955; together with a graveyard with stele in memory of members of Argentine expeditions who died in the area.

properties.brief_desc: Hut and grave on Paulet Island, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Stone hut built in February 1903 by survivors of the wrecked vessel Antarctic under Captain Carl A. Larsen, members of the Swedish South Polar Expedition led by Otto Nordenskjld, together with a grave of a member of the expedition and the rock cairn bui

properties.brief_desc: Huts, magnetic observatory and graveyard at Scotia Bay, Laurie Island, South Orkney Islands
properties.full_descr: Area of Scotia Bay, Laurie Island, South Orkney Island, in which are found: stone hut built in 1903 by the Scottish Antarctic Expedition led by William S. Bruce; the Argentine meteorological hut and magnetic observatory, built in 1905 and known as Moneta

properties.brief_desc: Plaque at Nivlisen ice front, Prinsesse Astrid Kyst, Dronning Maud Land
properties.full_descr: Plaque erected at the temporary Indian station ?Dakshin Gangotri?, Princess Astrid Kyst, Dronning Maud Land, listing the names of the First Indian Antarctic Expedition which landed nearby on 9 January 1982.

properties.brief_desc: Plaque at Metchnikoff Point, Brabant Island, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Plaque mounted at a height of 70 m on the crest of the moraine separating this point from the glacier

properties.brief_desc: Buildings and installations at Port-Martin, Terre Adlie
properties.full_descr: All the buildings and installations of Port Martin base, Terre Adlie constructed in 1950 by the 3rd French expedition in Terre Adlie and partly destroyed by fire during the night of 23 to 24 January 1952.

properties.brief_desc: Building on le des Ptrels, Terre Adlie
properties.full_descr: Wooden building called ?Base Marret? on the Ile des Ptrels, Terre Adlie, where seven men under the command of Mario Marret wintered in 1952 following the fire at Port Martin base.

properties.brief_desc: Cross on le des Ptrels, Terre Adlie
properties.full_descr: Iron cross on the north?east headland of the Ile des Ptrels, Terre Adlie, dedicated as a memorial to Andr Prudhomme, head meteorologist in the 3rd International Geophysical Year expedition who disappeared during a blizzard on 7 January 1959.

properties.brief_desc: Pillar at Bunger Hill, Queen Mary Land
properties.full_descr: The concrete pillar erected by the First Polish Antarctic Expedition at Dobrolowski Station on the Bunger Hill to measure acceleration due to gravity g = 982439.40.4 mgal in relation to Warsaw, according to the Potsdam system, in January 1959.

properties.brief_desc: Plaque at Fildes Peninsula, King George Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: A brass plaque bearing the Polish Eagle, the national emblem of Poland, the dates 1975 and 1976, and the following text in Polish, English and Russian:

properties.brief_desc: Grave and cross at Admiralty Bay, King George Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: The grave of Wlodzimierz Puchalski, surmounted by an iron cross, on a hill to the south of Arctowski station on King George Island. W. Puchalski was an artist and a producer of documentary nature films, who died on 19 January 1979 whilst working at the s

properties.brief_desc: Monolith at Fildes Peninsula, King George Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: Monolith erected to commemorate the establishment on 20February 1985 by the Peoples Republic of China of the ?Great Wall Station? on Fildes Peninsula, King George Island, in the South Shetland Islands

properties.brief_desc: Monolith and plaques on Elephant Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: Bust of Captain Luis Alberto Pardo, monolith and plaques on Point Wild, Elephant Island, South Shetland Islands, celebrating the rescue of the survivors of the British ship Endurance by the Chilean Navy cutter Yelcho

properties.brief_desc: Bust on Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Richard E.Byrd Historic Monument, McMurdo Station, Antarctica. Bronze bust on black marble, 5ft high  2ft square, on wood platform, bearing inscriptions describing the polar achievements of Richard Evelyn Byrd. Erected at McMurdo Station in 1965.

properties.brief_desc: Buildings and artefacts on Stonington Island, Marguerite Bay, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: East Base, Antarctica, Stonington Island. Buildings and artefacts at East Base, Stonington Island and their immediate environs. These structures were erected and used during two U.S. wintering expeditions: the Antarctic Service Expedition (1939?41) and t

properties.brief_desc: Remains of hut and environs at Waterboat Point, Danco Coast, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: The remains and immediate environs of the Waterboat Point hut. It was occupied by the UK two?man expedition of Thomas W. Bagshawe and Maxime C. Lester in 1921?22. Only the base of the boat, foundations of doorposts and an outline of the hut and extension

properties.brief_desc: Plaque at ?Yankee Bay? (Yankee Harbour), MacFarlane Strait, Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: Commemorative plaque at ?Yankee Bay? (Yankee Harbour), MacFarlane Strait, Greenwich Island, South Shetland Islands. Near a Chilean refuge. Erected to the memory of Captain Andrew MacFarlane, who in 1820 explored the Antarctic Peninsula area in the brigan

properties.brief_desc: Cairn on Half Moon Beach, Cape Shirreff, Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: A cairn on Half Moon Beach, Cape Shirreff, Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands and a plaque on ?Cerro Gaviota? opposite San Telmo Islets commemorating the officers, soldiers and seamen aboard the Spanish vessel San Telmo, which sank in September 18

properties.brief_desc: Plaque and cairn at ?Penguins Bay?, Seymour Island, James Ross Island archipelago
properties.full_descr: Wooden plaque and cairn located at Penguins Bay, southern coast of Seymour Island (Marambio), James Ross Archipelago. This plaque was placed on 10 November 1903 by the crew of a rescue mission of the Argentinean corvette Uruguay in the site where they me

properties.brief_desc: ?Base A? at Port Lockroy, Goudier Island, off Wiencke Island, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Of historic importance as an Operation Tabarin base from 1944 and for scientific research, including the first measurements of the ionosphere, and the first recording of an atmospheric whistler, from Antarctica. Port Lockroy was a key monitoring site dur

properties.brief_desc: ?Base E? on Stonington Island, Marguerite Bay, western Graham Land
properties.full_descr: Of historical importance in the early period of exploration and later British Antarctic Survey (BAS) history of the 1960s and 1970s.

properties.brief_desc: Message post on Foyn Island, Possession Islands
properties.full_descr: A pole with a box attached was placed on the island on 16January 1895 during the whaling expedition of Henryk Bull and Captain Leonard Kristensen of the ship Antarctic. It was examined and found intact by the British Antarctic Expedition of 1898?1900 an

properties.brief_desc: Cairn at Scott Nunataks, Alexandra Mountains
properties.full_descr: Prestrud?s Cairn, Scott Nunataks, Alexandra Mountains, Edward VII Peninsula. The small rock cairn was erected at the foot of the main bluff on the north side of the nunataks by Lieutenant K. Prestrud on 3 December 1911 during the Norwegian Antarctic Expe

properties.brief_desc: Rock shelter ?Granite House? at Cape Geology, Granite Harbour
properties.full_descr: This shelter was constructed in 1911 for use as a field kitchen by Griffith Taylor?s second geological excursion during the British Antarctic Expedition of 1910?13. It was enclosed on three sides with granite boulder walls and used a sledge to support a

properties.brief_desc: ?Base F (Wordie House)? on Winter Island, Argentine Islands
properties.full_descr: Of historic importance as an example of an early British scientific base.

properties.brief_desc: Depot at Hells Gate Moraine, Inexpressible Island, Terra Nova Bay
properties.full_descr: This emergency depot consisted of a sledge loaded with supplies and equipment which was placed on 25 January 1913 by the British Antarctic Expedition, 1910?13. The sledge and supplies were removed in 1994 in order to stabilize their deteriorating conditi

properties.brief_desc: Message post at Cape Crozier, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Erected on 22 January 1902 by Captain Robert F. Scott?s Discovery Expedition of 1901?04. It was to provide information for the expedition?s relief ships, and held a metal message cylinder, which has since been removed.

properties.brief_desc: Message post at Cape Wadworth, Coulman Island
properties.full_descr: A metal cylinder nailed to a red pole 8 m above sea level placed by Captain Robert F. Scott on 15 January 1902. He painted the rocks behind the post red and white to make it more conspicuous.

properties.brief_desc: Rocher du Dbarquement (Landing Rock)
properties.full_descr: Rocher du Dbarquement (Landing Rock) is a small island where Admiral d?Urville and his crew landed on 21January1840 when he discovered Terre Adlie.

properties.brief_desc: Whaling station at Whalers Bay, Deception Island
properties.full_descr: Whalers Bay, Deception Island, South Shetland Islands. The site comprises all pre?1970 remains on the shore of Whalers Bay, including those from the early whaling period (1906?12) initiated by Captain Adolfus Andresen of the Sociedad Ballenera de Magalla

properties.brief_desc: Ruins of base ?Pedro Aguirre Cerda?, Pendulum Cove, Deception Island
properties.full_descr: The ruins of the Base Pedro Aguirre Cerda Station, being a Chilean meteorological and volcanological centre situated at Pendulum Cove, Deception Island, Antarctica, which was destroyed by volcanic eruptions in 1967 and 1969.

properties.brief_desc: Cape Denison
properties.full_descr: Cape Denison, Commonwealth Bay, George V Land, including Boat Harbour and the historic artefacts contained within its waters. Site incorporated within Antarctic Specially Managed Area No.3. Part of this site is also designated as Antarctic Specially Pro

properties.brief_desc: Memorial plaque at India Point
properties.full_descr: Memorial plaque at India Point, Humboldt Mountains, Wohlthat Massif, central Dronning Maud Land erected in memory of three scientists of the Geological Survey of India (GSI) and a communication technician from the Indian Navy? all members of the ninth I

properties.brief_desc: Antarctic Treaty Monument
properties.full_descr: Monument to the Antarctic Treaty and plaque. The monument is located near the Frei, Bellingshausen and Escudero bases, Fildes Peninsula, King George Island (25 de Mayo Island). The plaque at the foot of the monument commemorates the signatories of the An

properties.brief_desc: Hut at Damoy Point, Dorian Bay, Wiencke Island, Palmer Archipelago
properties.full_descr: The site consists of a well-preserved hut which contains scientific equipment and other artefacts. The hut was erected in 1973 and used as a British Summer air facility and transit station for scientific personnel. The hut was last occupied in1993.

properties.brief_desc: Plaque Commemorating the PM-3A Nuclear Power Plant at McMurdo Station
properties.full_descr: The plaque is approximately 18x24 inches and cast in bronze. The text describes the major achievements of the PM?3A nuclear power plant, Antarctica?s first nuclear power plant. The plaque is secured to a large vertical rock located near the PM-3A react

properties.brief_desc: No. 1 Building at Great Wall Station
properties.full_descr: The building is located in the centre area of Chinese Antarctic Great Wall Station which is located at Fildes Peninsula, King George Island, South Shetlands, West Antarctica. The building is an overhead assembled housing with exposed steel structure. The

properties.brief_desc: Amundsen?s Tent
properties.full_descr: The tent was erected at 90 by the Norwegian group of explorers led by Roald Amundsen on their arrival at the South Pole on 14 December 1911. The tent is currently buried underneath the snow and ice in the vicinity of the South Pole.

properties.brief_desc: Shelter at Paradise Harbour, Danco Coast, Antarctic Peninsula
properties.full_descr: Shelter erected in 1950 near the Chilean Base ?Gabriel Gonzalez Videla? to honour Gabriel Gonzalez Videla, the first Head of State to visit the Antarctic. The shelter is a representative example of pre?IGY activity and constitutes an important national c

properties.brief_desc: Lillie Marleen Hut, Mt. Dockery, Everett Range, Northern Victoria Land
properties.full_descr: Lillie Marleen Hut was erected to support the work of the German Antarctic Northern Victoria Land Expedition (GANOVEX I) of 1979?80. The hut, a bivouac container made of prefabricated fibreglass units insulated with polyurethane foam, was named after the

properties.brief_desc: Rock cairn and plaque on Proclamation Island, Enderby Land
properties.full_descr: Rock cairn and plaque erected in January 1930 by Sir Douglas Mawson. The cairn and plaque commemorate the landing on Proclamation Island of Sir Douglas Mawson with a party from the British, Australian and New Zealand Antarctic Research Expedition of 1929

properties.brief_desc: Bust and plaque at ?Pole of Inaccessibility?
properties.full_descr: Station building to which a bust of V.I. Lenin is fixed, together with a plaque in memory of the conquest of the Pole of Inaccessibility by Soviet Antarctic explorers in 1958.

properties.brief_desc: Rock cairn and plaque at Cape Bruce, Mac. Robertson Land
properties.full_descr: Rock cairn and plaque, erected in February 1931 by Sir Douglas Mawson. The cairn and plaque commemorate the landing on Cape Bruce of Sir Douglas Mawson with a party from the British, Australian and New Zealand Antarctic Research Expedition of 1929?31.

properties.brief_desc: Rock cairn and canister at Walkabout Rocks, Vestfold Hills, Princess Elizabeth Land
properties.full_descr: Rock cairn erected in 1939 by Sir Hubert Wilkins. The cairn houses a canister containing a record of his visit.

properties.brief_desc: Stone and plaque at Mabus Point, Queen Mary Land
properties.full_descr: Stone with inscribed plaque, erected at Mirny Observatory, Mabus Point, in memory of driver?mechanic Ivan Kharma who perished on fast ice in the performance of official duties in 1956.

properties.brief_desc: Base ?W?, Detaille Island, Lallemand Fjord, Loubet Coast
properties.full_descr: Base ?W? is situated on a narrow isthmus at the northern end of Detaille Island, Lallemand Fjord, Loubet Coast. The base was established in 1956 as a British science base primarily for survey, geology and meteorology and to contribute to the Internationa

properties.brief_desc: Tractor and plaque at Vostok Station
properties.full_descr: Heavy tractor at Vostok Station with plaque in memory of the opening of the Station in 1957.

properties.brief_desc: Plaque at Potter Cove, King George Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: Replica of a metal plaque erected by Eduard Dallmann at Potter Cove, King George Island, to commemorate the visit of his German expedition on 1 March 1874 on board Grnland.

properties.brief_desc: ?Base Y? on Horseshoe Island, Marguerite Bay, western Graham Land
properties.full_descr: Noteworthy as a relatively unaltered and completely equipped British scientific base of the late 1950s. ?Blaiklock?, the refuge hut nearby, is considered an integral part of the base.

properties.brief_desc: Cairn on Tryne Islands, Vestfold Hills
properties.full_descr: A rock cairn and a wooden mast erected by the landing party led by Captain Klarius Mikkelsen of the Norwegian whaling ship Thorshavn and including Caroline Mikkelsen, Captain Mikkelsen?s wife, the first woman to set foot on East Antarctica. The cairn was

properties.brief_desc: Memorial Cross, Lewis Bay, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: Memorial Cross for the 1979 Mount Erebus crash victims, Lewis Bay, Ross Island. A cross of stainless steel which was erected in January 1987 on a rocky promontory three kilometres from the Mount Erebus crash site in memory of the 257 people of different

properties.brief_desc: Wreckage of sailing ship, Elephant Island, South Shetland Islands
properties.full_descr: The unnamed cove on the south?west coast of Elephant Island, including the foreshore and the intertidal area, in which the wreckage of a large wooden sailing vessel is located.

properties.brief_desc: ?A Hut?, Pram Point, Ross Island
properties.full_descr: The A Hut of Scott Base, being the only existing Trans Antarctic Expedition 1956?57 building in Antarctica sited at Pram Point, Ross Island, Ross Sea Region, Antarctica.

properties.brief_desc: Cross at ?Piedrabuena Bay?, Filchner Ice Front, Weddell Sea
properties.full_descr: Cross erected in 1955, at a distance of 1300 metres north?east of the Argentine General Belgrano I Station (Argentina) and subsequently moved to Belgrano II Station (Argentina), Nunatak Bertrab, Confin Coast, Coats Land in 1979.
